info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Richmond, southwestern Westmoreland and central Essex Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Champlain, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. In addition, Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Montross and Newland around 450 PM EDT. Tappahannock and Warsaw around 515 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ethel, Hustle, Elevon, Singerly, Peeds, Rexburg, Foneswood, Chance, Naylors Beach and Mount Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
